name: 黃如瑩
objective: 本課程主旨在向各級學校的英語師資，或對西洋文學文化有興趣的社會人士，推薦英美文學經典作品作為創意教學的教材藍本，兼具創意教學此一領域的理論介紹與創作實務。學員們藉由對英美經典文學作品與其相關之多媒體文化產物的研讀和探索，激起反應、反省與靈感，進而以英文創作作為回饋，朝向創意產業邁進。本課程設計的目標在激發學員多方面的能力：（1）瞭解英美經典文學作品的文字之美與文化意涵、（2）用英語表達的習慣、（3）用英文創作的潛能、以及（4）進入英語文化創意產業的準備。
schedule:
I. Required Text: 
(1)  A reader of literary masterpieces
Week 1 Introduction
Unit One: Mythology and Cultural Literacy
Week 2. Presentation on Norse mythology
Week 3. Teaching Homer’s Iliad
Week 4. Teaching Homer’s Odyssey
Week 5. Teaching Beowulf
Week 6. Teaching The Canterbury Tales
Week 7. Teaching Sir Gawain and the Green Knight
Week 8. Teaching Morte Darthur (The Death of King Arthur)
Week 9 Midterm exam week
Week 10. Presentation on literary pedagogy 
Week 11.Teaching Shakespeare’s tragedies
Week 12. Teaching Shakespeare’s comedies
Week 13. Teaching Shakespeare’s sonnets
Week 14.Teaching Emily Dickinson’s poetry
Week 15.Teaching Jane Austin’s novels
Week 16. Teaching JRR Tolkien’s Lord of the Rings
Week 17. Teaching C.S. Lewis’s The Chronicles of Narnia
Week 18. Final exam week
scorePolicy:
Percentile of final grades:
1. Attendance and participation: 40% (Four unexcused absences automatically lead to failure for the final grade; one absence results in a 10% deduction)
2. Presentation in the class: 20%
3. Midterm exam 20%; Final exam 20%
materials:
1.Responding to Literature by Judith A. Stanford, 5th edition
2.A Handbook to Literature by Harmon and Holman, 9th edition
3.Compass Classic Readers, 10 books x 6 levels = 60 books
4.A Guide to Writing about Art by Sylvan Barnet
